annotations.description: The fans can't complain about what they saw on the pitch as both sides displayed a highly captivating football match. The Real Madrid fans must be pleased with the performance of their team. They were absolutely the better of the two sides. The hosts defended well and were deadly on the counter attack. The away side displayed some nice build up play using a lot of passes.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Sergio Ramos (Real Madrid) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Antonio Mateu Lahoz didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Stipe Pletikosa pulls off a great save to deny Marcelo (Real Madrid), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: James Rodriguez (Real Madrid) works the corner short.
Half chance! Marcelo (Real Madrid) plays a pass into the box, but Stipe Pletikosa reacts well to snuff out the attack. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Real Madrid.
Real Madrid are showing great team chemistry. They are passing the ball around seamlessly.
Great ball in from Daniel Carvajal. Isco (Real Madrid) should really have done better with a close range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the left post.
Flag goes up against James Rodriguez (Real Madrid) and the referee blows his whistle for offside. The referee blows his whistle for offside.

What a great chance for Rober Vilalba (Dep. La Coruna). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header inside the right post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save.

What a poor attempt! Daniel Carvajal (Real Madrid) drives another shot towards goal this time from further out, but it couldn't have been worse if he had shot blindfolded. The ball goes into the stands.

Daniel Carvajal (Real Madrid) controls the ball after receiving a lofted pass, but he blazes it into the stands. Such a quick situation requires a cool head.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Cristiano Ronaldo will be replaced by James Rodriguez (Real Madrid).

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The game restarts for the second half.

So far we have been witnesses to an entertaining encounter between these two teams. Let's hope there will not be a decline in the spectacle in the second half. Real Madrid have arguably been the better of the two sides in the first half. The home team tries to find the weakness in the opposition's defence, especially with rapid counter attacks, while the away team play possession football.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) slams the ball from a long range free kick. He should have curled it higher to avoid hitting the wall.
Antonio Mateu Lahoz blows his whistle after Pedro Mosquera Parada (Dep. La Coruna) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. It's a free kick to Real Madrid in a dangerous position.
Another attempt to send the ball beyond the defence by Pedro Mosquera Parada (Dep. La Coruna) is thwarted and cleared to safety.
Marcelo (Real Madrid) delivers a fine lofted cross into the penalty area, but it's cleared by an opposing player.
Luka Modric (Real Madrid) makes an overly aggressive challenge and Antonio Mateu Lahoz blows his whistle for a foul.

Karim Benzema (Real Madrid) unleashed a monstrous piledriver. He controlled a pass, glanced up at goal and shot from the edge of the box. It could have been a difficult one for the keeper, but the ball fortunately hit one of the defenders and ball bounced away.
Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him.
Fernando Navarro (Dep. La Coruna) swings in a cross, but the ball is cleared to safety by one of the defending players.
Federico Cartabia (Dep. La Coruna) clips an inviting cross into the box, but there's no one in a position to get on the end of it.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Federico Cartabia (Dep. La Coruna), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.
Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) breaks past challenges inside the box, but puts too much pace on his pass to Marcelo.

What a great touch by Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid)! He picks up a precise pass inside the box and immediately produces a shot towards the net. Unfortunately for him, his bullet only crashes against the crossbar.

Real Madrid string together a series of short passes.
